content:
Hello all! This is the thread of discussion for the talk of Lachlan McPheat, Mehrnoosh Sadrzadeh, Hadi Wazni and Gijs Wijnholds, "Categorical Vector Space Semantics for Lambek Calculus with a Relevant Modality".
Date and time: Wednesday July 8, 11:00 UTC.
Zoom meeting: https://mit.zoom.us/j/7055345747
YouTube live stream: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AaaoUxUx-SQ&list=PLCOXjXDLt3pZDHGYOIqtg1m1lLOURjl1Q
Iâ€™m curious about how you code up all this theory on the first part of the talk and how it relates to cosine similarity, which I might have missed
Hey Lachlan & Hadi, thanks for the talk! I remember Mehrnoosh saying in the zoom chat that the code was not open sourced yet, is it gonna be at some point?

It would be super exciting to use DisCoPy to implement some future experiments, we could work together on defining Lambek Calculus in terms of diagrams, then monoidal functors to numpy would handle all the computation.
